markdownRemark.html: The goal of this project is to create power supply with adjustable voltage and current limit, using cheap parts or parts I had lying around. The power supply is based on a linear regulator, comprised of LM324 operation amplifier and TIP41 BJT as pass transistor, and switching-mode preregulator, which is buck converter realised with LM2576-ADJ. The preregulator keeps constant 1.5 V on the linear regulator. For controlling the power supply, PIC16F18855 microcontroller is used, with LCD with 2 rows and 16 columns and rotary encoder for user interface. The firmware is develop using Mplab X IDE, with the free version of the XC8 compiler.
